acne/rosacea.description: Acne is a persistent skin condition that arises when hair follicles become obstructed due to excess oil and dead skin cells. It commonly presents as blackheads, whiteheads, pimples, and may lead to scarring.
acne/rosacea.causes: Apart from genetic factors, other possible contributors include hormonal imbalances, bacterial infections, dietary influences, and psychological stress.

actinic_keratosos/basal_cell_carcinoma.description: Actinic keratosis is a rough, scaly patch of skin that forms due to prolonged exposure to ultraviolet radiation. It is considered a precursor to certain skin cancers and is more frequent in lighter skin tones.
actinic_keratosos/basal_cell_carcinoma.symptoms: Actinic keratoses often manifest as dry, flaky patches with a red or irritated base, varying in thickness.
actinic_keratosos/basal_cell_carcinoma.causes: Long-term exposure to sunlight or tanning beds results in DNA damage, leading to abnormal skin cell growth.

eczema.description: Eczema, or dermatitis, refers to a group of skin disorders marked by redness, itching, and inflammation. Some cases cause blisters, while chronic cases lead to skin thickening.
eczema.symptoms: Commonly affects the arms, knees, face, and hands, causing dryness, redness, and intense itching.
eczema.causes: A mix of hereditary and environmental elements contributes to its development, although the exact trigger remains unclear.

melanma/nevi/moles.description: Melanoma is an aggressive skin cancer that originates in pigment-producing cells known as melanocytes. It often affects the skin but may develop in other body regions.
melanma/nevi/moles.symptoms: Changes in mole shape, color, or size, and the emergence of new growths that may itch, bleed, or ulcerate.
melanma/nevi/moles.causes: UV radiation exposure and genetic predisposition contribute to cell mutations, increasing the likelihood of melanoma.

psoriasis/lichen.description: Psoriasis is an autoimmune disorder that accelerates skin cell turnover, leading to dry, scaly, and inflamed patches.
psoriasis/lichen.symptoms: Characterized by raised, red plaques covered with silvery scales, typically appearing on the elbows, knees, scalp, and back.
psoriasis/lichen.causes: The exact origin is unknown, but immune system dysfunction combined with genetic and environmental elements is suspected.

tinea_ringworm/candidiasis.description: Candidiasis is a fungal infection caused by Candida species, often affecting the mouth, throat, skin, and genitals. It may result in irritation and discomfort.
tinea_ringworm/candidiasis.symptoms: Redness, itching, and white patches on affected areas, sometimes leading to difficulty swallowing if present in the mouth.
tinea_ringworm/candidiasis.causes: Fungal overgrowth occurs when the body's natural balance is disrupted due to factors like a weakened immune system, antibiotic use, or excessive moisture.

urticaria/hives.description: Hives are a temporary skin reaction characterized by red, raised, and itchy welts that can shift locations within hours.
urticaria/hives.symptoms: Raised, itchy patches that may appear suddenly and move across different parts of the skin.
urticaria/hives.causes: Triggered by allergens, environmental changes, medications, or autoimmune responses leading to histamine release.

nail_fungus.description: Nail fungus is an infection that causes nails to become discolored, thickened, and brittle, often affecting toenails more than fingernails.
nail_fungus.symptoms: Nails may appear yellowish, cracked, distorted, or develop an unpleasant odor.
nail_fungus.causes: Dermatophytes, yeasts, or molds invade the nail, often thriving in warm, moist environments like sweaty shoes.
